bullets.text: Political loyalty tests around Trump cases hinder DOJ prosecutor recruiting, potentially slowing federal enforcement and increasing institutional strain.
Venezuela releases key opposition figures to court U.S. support, raising odds of sanction easing and increased oil exports.
Japan’s Takaichi wins snap election; LDP supermajority boosts policy certainty and drives Nikkei to record highs as investors price pro-growth agenda.
Portugal elects left-leaning president, halting far-right surge and signaling near-term policy stability within EU.
Thailand conservative party’s surprise victory could shift economic priorities and foreign policy, creating near-term uncertainty for markets and protests risk.
Hong Kong jails Jimmy Lai for 20 years, deepening rule-of-law concerns and worsening China-West tensions for global firms.
After volatile week, investors focus on U.S. jobs and inflation prints that could swing Fed rate expectations and equity valuations.
Super Bowl betting spotlights prediction markets versus sportsbooks; legal and liquidity battles may redefine U.S. gambling, hedging, and event-derivatives regulation.
A.I. chatbots increasingly used for retirement planning, but advice quality, liability, and bias raise consumer-protection issues for fintech and regulators.
‘Trump accounts’ pitched for children highlight politicized retail finance; investors should scrutinize tax treatment, fees, custody, and conflicts.
Epstein records expand scrutiny of Silicon Valley and prompt calls for U.S. Commerce chief Lutnick’s resignation, increasing governance and reputational risk.
Scientists say climate models may omit a key ocean component, potentially underestimating warming and extreme-weather impacts—important for adaptation, infrastructure, and insurance pricing.
Research advances: a new circadian drug cuts jet-lag recovery nearly in half; separate work shows signed bootloaders can bypass UEFI Secure Boot.
